title: Drawing, "The Music Party", ca. 1850
medium: Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper
signed: Lower right, in black ink: C  Obach; upper center, on mat, in old script: Rossi
inscribed: Lower right, on mat, in old script: hommage de l'auteur
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Thomas Agnew & Sons, Ltd., London; Christie's, London, July 17, 1979, lot 138 (illus.); Henri, Duc de Bordeaux, titular King Henri of France and Navarre (d.1883)
description: In this typical music group, a woman dressed in an elegant white silk gown is seated at the harp; a second woman is seated at the piano; a man, standing, plays the violin; and another man, seated, plays the cello. The family spaniel looks on. The walls appear to be of gray stucco (?) with a classical frieze at the top. The floor is stenciled in a colorful circular pattern.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Music Party", ca. 1850.
ca. 1850. Brush and watercolor, white gouache, graphite on paper. Thaw Collection. 2007-27-46.
